title: Option Volatility and Pricing Models
text: can install development version oplib like :
code: if (!require(devtools)) install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("wilsonfreitas/oplib")

what: Pricing Equity Options with Black-Scholes-Merton Model
title: Option Volatility and Pricing Models
text: Pricing options Black-Scholes-Merton Model (BSM Model).

title: Option Volatility and Pricing Models
text: can get option prices {rb3} compute implied volatility.
code: library(rb3) library(bizdays) #>  #> Attaching package: 'bizdays' #> The following object is masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     offset library(tidyverse) #> -- Attaching packages ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- tidyverse 1.3.1 -- #> v ggplot2 3.3.6     v purrr   0.3.4 #> v tibble  3.1.7     v dplyr   1.0.9 #> v tidyr   1.2.0     v stringr 1.4.0 #> v readr   2.1.2     v forcats 0.5.1 #> -- Conflicts ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- tidyverse_conflicts() -- #> x readr::edition_get()   masks testthat::edition_get() #> x dplyr::filter()        masks stats::filter() #> x purrr::is_null()       masks testthat::is_null() #> x dplyr::lag()           masks stats::lag() #> x readr::local_edition() masks testthat::local_edition() #> x dplyr::matches()       masks tidyr::matches(), testthat::matches()  refdate <- preceding(Sys.Date() - 3, "Brazil/B3") ch <- cotahist_get(refdate, "daily") yc <- yc_get(refdate) op <- cotahist_equity_options_superset(ch, yc)  symbol_ <- "B3SA3" op1 <- op |>   filter(     symbol.underlying == symbol_   ) maturities <- unique(op1$maturity_date) |> sort() close_underlying <- op1$close.underlying[1]  op_vol <- op1 |>   filter(maturity_date %in% maturities[1:2]) |>   mutate(     biz_days = bizdays(       refdate, following(maturity_date, "Brazil/B3"), "Brazil/B3"     ),     time_to_maturity = biz_days / 252,     rate = log(1 + r_252),     impvol = bsmimpvol(       close, type, close.underlying, strike, time_to_maturity, rate, 0     ),     delta = bsmdelta(       type, close.underlying, strike, time_to_maturity, rate, 0, impvol     ),     adj_delta = ifelse(str_to_lower(type) == "call", delta, 1 + delta)   ) |>   select(     symbol, volume,     type, close.underlying, strike, time_to_maturity, rate, impvol,     delta, adj_delta, biz_days, volume   ) op_vol |>   filter(!is.na(impvol)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = adj_delta, y = impvol, colour = type, size = volume)) +   geom_point() +   geom_vline(xintercept = 0.5, alpha = 0.5, size = 1) +   facet_wrap(~ biz_days) +   theme(legend.position = "bottom") +   labs(     x = "Delta", y = "Implied Volatility",     title = str_glue("Equity Options Volatility - {symbol_} {format(refdate)}")   )

title: Annualize Volatility or Variance — annualize
text: Transforms variance volatility annual. default method, classes "volatility", "variance", supported.

title: Annualize Volatility or Variance — annualize
code: annualize(x, ...)  # S3 method for volatility annualize(x, dib = 252, ...)  # S3 method for variance annualize(x, dib = 252, ...)

title: Annualize Volatility or Variance — annualize
text: x object whose class determine method dispatched. Volatility variance, become annual. ... arguments passed next method. dib days one year, day count convention.

title: Annualize Volatility or Variance — annualize
text: class annual volatility variance.

title: Annualize Volatility or Variance — annualize
code: annualize(as.variance(.5)) #> Annual Variance 252 days  #> [1] 126 annualize(as.volatility(.25)) #> Annual Volatility (%) 252 days  #> [1] 396.8627

title: variance Class Coercing — as.variance
text: Generic function coercing "variance". default method method "volatility".

title: variance Class Coercing — as.variance
code: as.variance(x, ...)  # S3 method for default as.variance(x, annualized = FALSE, dib = NULL, ...)  # S3 method for volatility as.variance(x, ...)

title: variance Class Coercing — as.variance
text: x object whose class determine method dispatched. Value volatility variance. ... arguments passed next method, : annualized default method, TRUE variance value x annualized, FALSE variance daily. dib days one year, day count convention.

title: variance Class Coercing — as.variance
text: values x "variance" class, according given daily annualized type.

title: variance Class Coercing — as.variance
volatility Class Coercing — as.volatility
text: Generic function coercing "volatility". default method method "variance".

title: volatility Class Coercing — as.volatility
code: as.volatility(x, ...)  # S3 method for default as.volatility(x, annualized = FALSE, dib = NULL, ...)  # S3 method for variance as.volatility(x, ...)

title: volatility Class Coercing — as.volatility
text: x object whose class determine method dispatched. Value volatility variance. ... arguments passed next method, : annualized default method, TRUE volatility value x annualized, FALSE volatility daily. dib days one year, day count convention.

title: volatility Class Coercing — as.volatility
text: values x volatility class, according given daily annualized type.

title: Computes the desired greek letter from Black-Scholes-Merton model. — bsmgreeks
text: Delta greek letter measures rate change theoretical option value respect changes underlying asset's price.

title: Computes the desired greek letter from Black-Scholes-Merton model. — bsmgreeks
text: Vega greek letter measures sensitivity volatility.

title: Computes the desired greek letter from Black-Scholes-Merton model. — bsmgreeks
text: Gamma greek letter measures rate change delta respect changes underlying price.

title: Computes the desired greek letter from Black-Scholes-Merton model. — bsmgreeks
text: Theta measures sensitivity value derivative passage time.

title: Computes the desired greek letter from Black-Scholes-Merton model. — bsmgreeks

what: Computes implied volatility inverting Black-Scholes-Merton formula. — bsmimpvol
title: Computes implied volatility inverting Black-Scholes-Merton formula. — bsmimpvol
text: Uses bisection method calculate implied volatility, given parameters Black-Scholes-Merton formula pricing options stocks.

title: Computes implied volatility inverting Black-Scholes-Merton formula. — bsmimpvol
code: bsmimpvol(   option_prices,   type,   spot,   strike,   time,   rate,   yield,   tolerance = .Machine$double.eps,   maxiter = 100,   check = any )

title: Computes implied volatility inverting Black-Scholes-Merton formula. — bsmimpvol
text: option_prices stock option price. type 'call' call option, value put. spot current stock price. strike strike price. time time option expiration years. rate risk-free interest rate. yield dividends expected paid. tolerance tolerance approximation. maxiter maximum number iterations bisection method. check function checking convergence bisections.

title: Computes implied volatility inverting Black-Scholes-Merton formula. — bsmimpvol
text: approximation implied volatility. algorithm converges maxiter reached, Black-Scholes-Merton formula calculated volatility differ option_prices tolerance.

title: Computes implied volatility inverting Black-Scholes-Merton formula. — bsmimpvol
text: arguments handle recycle rule vectors can provided vectors differs length recycle rule applied.

title: Computes implied volatility inverting Black-Scholes-Merton formula. — bsmimpvol

Daily Volatility or Variance — daily
text: Transforms variance volatility daily. default method, classes "volatility", "variance", supported.

title: Daily Volatility or Variance — daily
code: daily(x, ...)  # S3 method for volatility daily(x, ...)  # S3 method for variance daily(x, ...)

title: Daily Volatility or Variance — daily
text: x object whose class determine method dispatched. Volatility variance, become daily. ... arguments passed next method.

title: Daily Volatility or Variance — daily
text: class daily volatility variance.

title: Daily Volatility or Variance — daily
code: daily(annualize(as.variance(.5))) #> Daily Variance  #> [1] 0.5 daily(annualize(as.volatility(.25))) #> Daily Volatility  #> [1] 0.25

what: Vectorial bisection method varying parameters from one function. — multiroot
title: Vectorial bisection method varying parameters from one function. — multiroot
text: Searches interval root (.e., zero) function func_ respect first argument. arguments may vectorial, multiroot return vector roots.

title: Vectorial bisection method varying parameters from one function. — multiroot
code: multiroot(   func_,   interval,   ...,   tolerance = .Machine$double.eps,   maxiter = 100,   check = function(...) any(..., na.rm = TRUE) )

title: Vectorial bisection method varying parameters from one function. — multiroot
text: func_ objective function root finding. interval vector containing end-points interval searched roots. ... additional named unnamed arguments passed func_, may vectorial, difference multiroot uniroot. tolerance desired accuracy (convergence tolerance). maxiter maximum number iterations. check function checking convergence roots. Since bisection method, .

title: Vectorial bisection method varying parameters from one function. — multiroot
text: Vector roots.

title: Vectorial bisection method varying parameters from one function. — multiroot
text: multiroot created aiming implied volatility calculation several options.

title: Vectorial bisection method varying parameters from one function. — multiroot
code: f <- function(x, y) x - y multiroot(f, c(-3, 10), 1:3) #> root: 1 2 3  #> iter: 55  #> err: 0 0 0  g <- function(sigma, premium, type, spot, strike, time, rate, yield) {   bsmprice(type, spot, strike, time, rate, yield, sigma) - premium } multiroot(g, c(1e-8, 10), 5, "call", 30, 31, c(1, 1.1, 1.2, 1.3), 0.15, 0) #> root: 0.2716932 0.2347013 0.1981046 0.1590767  #> iter: 100  #> err: -3.552714e-15 -3.552714e-15 -3.552714e-15 0

title: SVI fit — svi_fit
text: Fits SVI model given smile defined strikes respective variances. Time maturity also provided non-arbitrage restriction.

title: SVI fit — svi_fit
code: svi_fit(variance, spot, strike, time, rate, yield = 0, initial_guess = NULL)

title: SVI fit — svi_fit
text: variance variances given strikes spot underlying spot price strike options strikes time time maturity years rate risk free rate yield yield rate initial_guess Initial guess used optimization process

title: SVI fit — svi_fit
text: list SVI model parameters , b, x, m, rho sigma.

title: SVI Variance — svi_var
text: Calculates variance given SVI model provided parameters.

title: SVI Variance — svi_var
code: svi_var(a, b, m, rho, x, sigma)

title: SVI Variance — svi_var
text: '' SVI model (instantaneous variance) b 'b' SVI model (speed variance mean reversion) m 'm' SVI model (long term expected variance) rho 'rho' SVI model (correlation variance price) x 'x' SVI model, given ln(K/F) K options strike price F underlying's future sigma 'sigma' SVI model (volatility variance)

title: SVI Variance — svi_var
